players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the mafioso.
Night 1 begins.
You killed Diana.
Diana was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Bob: "I am the detective. I investigated Alice last night — Alice is the mafioso. Vote to arrest Alice now."
Charlie: "I don't trust quick, absolute claims. Bob, why did you investigate Alice so fast, and can you share any proof or details of your investigation?"

You: "I didn't do it. Bob, your claim is convenient and sudden — why would you immediately investigate me and then demand my arrest without sharing any investigation details? That looks like a setup to pin suspicion on an inactive player quickly."
You: "I stand by what I said: Bob's claim is too neat. If Bob truly investigated me, why not give details — when did you investigate, what method, or what evidence? Charlie's right to ask for proof."
Bob: "I investigated Alice on Night 1 and got a clear result: Alice is the mafioso. Diana was killed that night, so we don't have time to hesitate — arrest Alice now."

Charlie: "I don't like rushing to lynch without evidence. Bob, if you're really the detective, tell us exactly when you investigated and what answer you got — specifics help. Alice, why did you vote to silence Bob instead of asking questions?"
